VIII.iii.8.A.3.c
.
Inextricably Intertwined Non-Camp Lejeune Legacy Appeals
For non-Camp Lejeune legacy appeals that are inextricably intertwined with a Camp Lejeune legacy appeal, the ROJ will take the actions indicated in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iii, 8.A.2.a
.
Upon receipt of a non-Camp Lejeune claim or legacy appeal, the Louisville RO will review to determine whether the non-Camp Lejeune legacy appeal or claim is inextricably intertwined with the Camp Lejeune legacy appeal.  If not inextricably intertwined, the Louisville RO will
annotate the decision in VACOLS and VBMS
remove any special issue indicators, and
return the legacy appeal to the originating ROJ.
References
:  For more information on
inextricably intertwined legacy appeals, see
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section A.1.g
, and
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section E.3.c and d
VACOLS, see the
VACOLS User Guide
, and
transferring EPs, see the
VBMS Core User Guide
.
